p: Group M, the pandemic branch of HIV-1 can be classified into different subtypes named A-D, F-H, J and K. Recombinant lineages generated through recombination between subtypes isolated from at least three epidemiologically unlinked individuals are known as circulating recombinant forms (CRFs), else these recombinants would be known as unique recombinant forms (URFs) [ 1].
